intro: Terpsichore longisetosa, commonly known as the long-hairs terpsichore, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and covered with fine, stiff hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Terpsichore longisetosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
